snippet: Theodore B. Olson and David Boies, who led the case that defeated California’s ban on same-sex marriage, want to play a central role in cases in Utah and Oklahoma, but they have not been met with open arms by the teams of lawyers already involved.
abstract: Theodore B Olson and David Boies, star legal duo who defied skeptics by successfully challenging California’s ban on same-sex marriage, are seeking to play central role in upcoming battles in Oklahoma and Utah; in so doing, they have ignited debate over who gets coveted job of arguing what could be landmark gay rights decision before Supreme Court.
lead_paragraph: Theodore B. Olson and David Boies, who led the case that defeated California’s ban on same-sex marriage, want to play a central role in cases in Utah and Oklahoma, but they have not been met with open arms by the teams of lawyers already involved.

headline.main: Olson and Boies, Legal Duo, Seek Role in 2 Cases on Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Legal Duo Seeks Role in 2 Cases on Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
